sep_float< FLT > Class Template Reference

This class stores a float, long or double as an integer significand and an integer exponent. More...

#include <sep_float.hpp>

List of all members.

Friends

std::ostream & operator<< (std::ostream &os, const sep_float< FLT > &x)
 This will put the floating point number on the output stream, not the seperated number.
int msdb (sep_float< FLT > x, sep_float< FLT > y)
 This function computes the most significant differing bit of two seperated floating point numbers. The return value is the exponent of the highest order bit that differs between the two numbers. Note: The msdb of the two floating point numbers is NOT computed based on the internal representation of the floating point number. The answer is computed based on a theoretical integer representation of the numbers.

Detailed Description

template<typename FLT>
class sep_float< FLT >

This class stores a float, long or double as an integer significand and an integer exponent.

sep_float type

Friends And Related Function Documentation

template<typename FLT>
int msdb ( sep_float< FLT >  x,
sep_float< FLT >  y 
) [friend]

This function computes the most significant differing bit of two seperated floating point numbers. The return value is the exponent of the highest order bit that differs between the two numbers. Note: The msdb of the two floating point numbers is NOT computed based on the internal representation of the floating point number. The answer is computed based on a theoretical integer representation of the numbers.

msdb function

Parameters:
x First value to be compared.
y Second value to be compared.
Returns:
Most significant differing bit of x and y
